titlestmt.titleproper: J. Walter Thompson Company. London Office. Jack Cronin papers
Guide to the J. Walter Thompson Company. London Office. Jack Cronin papers, 1964-1996 and undated RL.11603
titlestmt.author: Richard Collier, Claire Payton

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-06-27 15:24:58 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: J. Walter Thompson Company. London Office. Jack Cronin papers

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History

did.abstract: Founded in 1864, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. It is headquartered in New York. The London Office first opened in 1899. John J. (Jack) Cronin was an advertising executive who managed JWT's Canadian and European operations before becoming Vice Chairman of JWT. Collection includes correspondence, financial and management statements; research reports; client files and other printed materials along with slides and videocassettes of presentations. Companies represented include various JWT offices as well as Burger King, ComputerLand, Ford, ITV, International Television Association (ITVA), Kellogg, Kraft, Nestle, Pepsi, Philips, Schick and Unilever. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.
did.langmaterial: Materials in English, French, German, Spanish, Turkish

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into the following series: Administration; Clients and Accounts; Correspondence and related materials; Financial; Presentations and speeches; Printed material; and Audiovisual materials

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Founded in 1864, the J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) is one of the oldest and largest enduring advertising agencies in the United States. It is headquartered in New York. The London Office first opened in 1899. John J. (Jack) Cronin was an advertising executive who managed JWT's Canadian and European operations before becoming Vice Chairman of JWT.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. However, original audiovisual materials are closed until use copies can be produced.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. There may be a 48-hour delay in obtaining these materials.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company. London Office. Jack Cronin papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as gifts in 1996 and 2008.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company. London Office. Jack Cronin papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 1996-0096, 1996-0168, 2008-0270

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center collections:

J. Walter Thompson Company. Account files; J. Walter Thompson Company. Corporate documentation; J. Walter Thompson Company. Frankfurt Office. George Black papers; J. Walter Thompson Company. Harry Clark papers; J. Walter Thompson Company. International advertisements; J. Walter Thompson Company. James Kennedy papers; J. Walter Thompson Company. London Office. Michael Cooper-Evans papers

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection includes correspondence, financial and management statements; research reports; client files and other printed materials along with slides and videocassettes of presentations. Materials are in English, French, German, Spanish, Turkish and other languages. Companies represented include various JWT offices as well as Burger King, ComputerLand, Ford, ITV, International Television Association (ITVA), Kellogg, Kraft, Nestle, Pepsi, Philips, Schick and Unilever. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising & Marketing History.
